findings.issue: Description says negative elasticity reduces labor supply, but negative elasticity times positive income would increase (make less negative) hours worked

findings.quote: Correct wage impact calculation by taking mean wage
findings.issue: Comment says "correct" but doesn't explain what was incorrect or why mean avoids double counting
Earlier defines service workers as lower wage bound but here implies they're distinct from knowledge workers without clear differentiation

errorDetails.raw:
[FINDING]
Category: logical_consistency
Severity: major
Line: 61
Quote: "incomeEffect = inputs.incomeElasticity * (inputs.ubiAmount / (inputs.avgWage * inputs.baseWorkHours))"
Issue: Income elasticity is negative but formula treats it as if reducing hours, creating sign confusion with later calculations
[/FINDING]

parsed.issue: Income elasticity is negative but formula treats it as if reducing hours, creating sign confusion with later calculations
